review: My friends and I have spent quite a bit of time enjoying multiplayer chaos. The game is pretty good, my only complaint would be that I wouldn't find a few more match options in multiplayer games. I want to be able to further customize the match rules. I also feel it doesn't have as good of weapons as Worms Armaggedon, however, that could be nostalgia talking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013395249', 'num_games_owned': 1234, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1518473727}
review:
Worms Clan Wars is another game at the famous franchise Worms. Like its predecessors, you'll create your team of worms and battle against other teams with an arsenal of weapons. However, this game has some changes from the previous versions and that's why is worth a shot.

[h1] Graphics[/h1] 
The graphics didn't change too much from the previous games. Th enviroment and the characters and colorful and lively, being nice to the eyes. 

[h1] Gameplay[/h1] 
The gameplay is the same of previous Worms: each player has your own turn and you choose one of your worms to do the action. You can move with the directional buttons, choose a weapon through your mouse or keyboard shortcuts and press the spacebar key to use the weapon. Depending of the weapon you choose, the effects at the opponent (and yourself) will be different, so you need to be cautious to not blown yourself up when you use the weapon. This is one of the many great things about the worms games, because a wrong use of a weapon can lead to very funny moments and even make you lose, instead of your opponent. When you use a weapon, your turn is over and it's your opponent turn. You win when every worm of your opponent is dead. If every worm, even yours, die, it will be a draw.

Also, you can also use some items which help you to fight or get a better position to knock out your enemy and, different of when you use a weapon, you won't finish your turn when using it. For example, with the ninja rope, your worm can reach high places and even shoot at your opponent while escaping for your own safety. For example, you can use the ninja rope to go higher and throw a dinamite at your opponent and, before the dynamite blows (you have only a couple of seconds), you can reach another safe place and watch your opponent getting blasted. Your opponent will be damaged by the explosion and be throw at the air because of the explosion and even can fall at the water, losing all its hp. By the way, there's water and you lose your worm if you fall there. Oops, didn't I say that before?

Anyway, it's really nice the huge variety of weapons for you to use at Worms Clan Wars. Plus, some of them are funny, like the powerful "Concrete Donkey", which, when used, a giant concrete donkey falls from the sky and go stomping every place at a vertical line, while doing a funny donkey sound.

By the way, I said before this game has some changes from its previous games. Well, this time, your worms are not equal. At previous games, every worm is exactly the same, changing only its name, but at this game, there are 4 types of worms, which can add some deep to your strategy. For example, there is the tiny worm, called "Scout", which can be faster and jump higher, but they are weaker than the another ones. In another hand, there's the "Heavy", which is the totally opposite of the Scout: it is fat and heavy, so it'll be slow and jump really low, but it's more powerful than the other ones. 

[h1] Audio & Soundtrack[/h1] 
There's not many musics here, but the few remaining are nice to hear. But the Audio and sound effects are great! They are nice and funny, specially the many voices you can use as your worms voice. You can laugh a lot with these.

[h1]Storyline[/h1] 
Worms usually has no fixed storyline, except this one has a campaign mode about some worms hunting some rare artifacts. But you don't need to do the campaign, if you prefer only fighting to the death against your friends or the AI or both.

[h1]The veredict[/h1]
It's another amazing Worms game, with some good improvements, but keeping the old and good formula of success that made Worms a loved franchise. If you love Worms games, don't miss this one. And if you never played a worms game, try this one! It's lovely and I think you will enjoy!

[h1]Rating:[/h1]
Graphics: 8/10
Audio: 10/10
Gameplay: 9,5/10
Overall: 9/10

review: I honestly loved the franchise, and played most of it. The game created a whole new genre, and didn't give a chance to any rivals to compete. This game, though, I feel like it's missing the soul of Worms. It limited many options which customized weaponry, and the amount you want for battle. Another thing is, the online system seems a bit unfair, and needs to balance it so that the person who gets the first turn is at a bit of a disadvantage because the players with the later turns can get teamed up upon, and just thrown off cliffs into water. Don't get me wrong, the game still kept many of the qualities, and is still fun to play with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042485131', 'num_games_owned': 1215, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1484546467}
review:
Sigh, you most likely already know what worms is about, it's one of the most well known video game series, and it is the essential party game. For the antisocial people that live under a rock (no offence though), Worms are creatures that have a long cylindrical tube-like body and no limbs. Worms the video game series is about teams of those creatures killing other teams of those creatures in a turn based format, sometimes with usual weapons, like an Uzi, and sometimes with a CONCRETE DONKEY.
But really, it is a very simple game, that's probably the reason why it's so popular, it's incredibly easy to just pick it up and play, and 18 years and 60 million copies sold later, the worms formula has been basically perfected.

Now, the worms games have been heavily criticised for publishing new games without much new content, and I completely agree, and this game also follows the same format, it's still the old 2D, worm killing, psychopath game we all love. But it also add some new content, I know, weird right?
This game has 3D graphics, the whole terrain, items, worms and weapons are fully modeled and rendered in 3D, even though the gameplay is in 2D. Also, it adds a single player campaign, now, I usually dislike having a single player campaign just for the sake of it, but in this game I feel like it is it's highlight, the story is really quirky and funny, and the narration by the psychopathic Crypt Creeper Tara Pinkle is just wonderful and really funny, one of the best parts of the game. The game also has an extensive character and terrain editor, with steam workshop compatibility, making it really fun to customize your game. And finally, the game has extensive additions to online multiplayer, there's a Clan option, allowing you to create a team up to 8 players and face off against other clans, and ranked mode, for both player vs player and clan vs clan, a clash of clans, if you will.

This game also looks really good, the 3D models and textures are really well done, and the game looks gorgeous, the 3D graphics are a step in the right mine-filled direction. And as I previously mentioned, the game has Steam Workshop compatibility, and it allows for some really funny and creative worms, like one that says Terry Crew's lines from the insane Old Spice commercials.
Also it has a very User-friendly interface, it's easy to figure out what each weapon does, the help menu is extensive, and the game has a great controller support. Also steam achievements and cards.

Overall, this game more than just more of the same, but it still is basically more of the same, so if you don't yet own a Worms game, this is undoubtedly the one for you, but if you already own one, the only real reason to get this one is Tara's spectacular voice acting.

Read more video game reviews at cassus.org

review:
I used to play Worms armageddon when I was young and enjoyed it A LOT.
Today I played Worms Clan Wars for the first time with a friend (online). 

between each turn we had to wait SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO long before we could actually do something.
Also the game felt a lot less fun thatn world party and armageddon...

I rate 3/10 - would not recommend!
Go buy one of the classics, even the art looks better...

author: {'steamid': '76561198200013267', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1480204720}
review:
I really don't like the checkpoint in the game, which will end your turn immediately once you touch it. The check point is something should be helping players, but in this case it becomes something I am trying my best to avoid touching--more like a trap than checkpoint. 

The Ninja Rope in this game is bad as well. Comparing to Reloaded (the only other worms game I played, it is also the reason why I bought Clan War), it is much worse. You have no way to control your rope if you touch the wall, but in Reloaded you can bouce off the wall, which made it possible to go from place to place using rope.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309561803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1585359388}
review:
The gameplay itself is ok but the graphics lack the clarity of earlier versions.  I found it hard to tell what was scenery and what was part of the game.  It looks very unappealing.

The AI is utterly dumb so the only challenge is navigating the maps and solving the puzzles.  It's also very CPU-intensive - it will sit there heating-up the CPU and turning-on the fans only to throw a grenade on itself.

I found the unskippable cut-scenes/intros very annoying, especially when you're replaying a level you lost.

I have only played story mode so far.

review:
An awfal entry to the Worms series.
The bassic issue i have agains this game is the 2.5D engine. So many bugs and so many frame drops that it's almost impossible to enjoy the game itself. If only i could count the worms died to me due to some stupid bug or unpredicted behaviour of the pyshics that it's just ridiculous.
Even if you're a Worms fan, do yourself a favour and skip this game.

review:
[i]Team 17 needs a new franchise. Hopefully they do overcooked 2.[/i] It's worms, the seminal 2d artillery game. I suppose at this point this is the worms game to get, it ticks all the boxes EDIT - now obseleted by worms WMD. It's got some weird "museum" theme happening in the metagame, doesn't add to the experience however. Hard to get excited about this given the similarity to the last worms game. And the one before that. And the one before that. And the one before that.

[h1] Good [/h1]
- it's the worms you know and love
- it's nicely balanced 
- plenty of content
- online play mostly works well

[h1] Bad [/h1]
- same ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• different game
- clunky ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• interface

Recommended I guess  [h1] 4/5 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198090231466', 'num_games_owned': 1724, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1623610781}
review:
Ich mag das Spiel.
Allerdings macht es wahrscheinlich nur Spa√ü, wenn man es mit ein paar Freunden zusammen zockt, ansonsten geht der Spa√üfaktor sehr schnell verloren.
Ich f√ºr meinen Teil habe schon sehr viele lustige Momente mit meinen Kumpels erlebt, Fails sind passiert und oft musste man wegen Bugs/Glitches im Spiel oder der eigenen Inkompetenz ausrasten.
Das Wasser ist in diesem Worms-Teil aufjedenfall um einiges besser als bei Revolution^^

Um euch nun einen kleinen Endruck von dem Spiel nahezulegen, empfehle ich, mal kurz in unsere Worms-Playlist reinzuschauen, in der viele lustige Videos von diesem Spiel aufgelistet sind: 
[url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL_vJI7dmaDaF3cZNUu6e5Rxiyo8_UCckn]Eigenwerbung STINKT :D[/url] 


Insgesamt ist es ein mehr als durchschnittliches Spiel, welches aufjedenfall ein Muss f√ºr Worms-Fans ist und ein nettes Gelegenheitsspiel mit Freunden f√ºr Casual-Spieler ist. Knapp 20‚Ç¨ sind daf√ºr auf keinen Fall zu viel verlangt!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042669538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1470006339}
review:
First of all a disclaimer: I've never played any of the other Worms titles, I'm a total newbie at this so you won't find any comparisons in this review, which seems to be quite unusual judging by most other reviews. I'm also on a deadline to write this and it's a large game so I haven't completed the campaign like I usually do before a review, but I've played enough to make a judgement I think.

This is a game that can be placed into 2 genres: puzzle platformer (single-player) and competitive/strategy (online multi-player).

[b]Story mode[/b] has bucketloads of charm and humour in keeping with the whole theme of the game. You progress along the main map and each level has an intro telling the story, explaining the objective and telling you to kill the enemy worms (in ever inventive language). You have a team of 4 worms, each with individual characteristics - big/slow with more powerful explosions or small/fast with less damage, and various other traits. Some levels you control all 4 and on some parts of the map they split up so you only have one or two. To complete levels you have to reach objectives by collecting weapons and killing enemy worms along the way. Some weapons are carried over to the next level, others have a limited number of uses, there are always variations in line with the puzzle element of the level. Some levels are an all-out turn-based battle, 60 seconds per turn in the levels I've played so far. In all cases, shooting at the enemy ends your turn. They have points values, some more than others, and if you only wound them then they get to shoot back at you and that's mainly how you can end up failing the level - there are other hazards too like machine guns, landmines etc.

[b]Worm Ops[/b] is more or less a tutorial with a single worm and a different weapon on each level to kill the enemy worms without any other objectives. The trickiest thing to learn is how much power to apply to your ranged weapons so they arc through the air accurately to hit the enemies. I suspect this is a key skill for experienced players but I still haven't got the hang of it, the enemy worms are much better at it than I am at this point.

[b]Multiplayer:[/b] my first foray was a "partial success", as they used to say on the Fast Show. I made several attempts to join matches but kept being rejected, perhaps because of my Beginner status. After a couple of hours I eventually I managed to join a game with two other players. It took so long to load I thought it was stuck and almost quit, then eventually the terrain appeared but one player immediately dropped out, or maybe failed to connect. The in-game chat didn't work for me so I couldn't reply to the other player, we took a couple of turns (during which I probably embarrassed myself) then he decided to quit so I won by default, whereupon the game [b]CRASHED[/b]. I think I'll need a lot more experience before trying to compete anyway, I was overwhelmed with a full array of weapons choices having only encountered a limited number of them so far during my single-player campaign, so I would have been dead meat in short order had the game progressed any further.

[h1]Pros[/h1]

[b]Katherine Parkinson's voiceover[/b] (she's the TV actress best known as Jen in The IT Crowd comedy). [b]Oh My. God.[/b] I could listen to her all day long anyway, but there's not another voice on the planet that could improve this particular game. Inspired choice.

[b]Aesthetics:[/b] crisp, detailed cartoony graphics and wonderful animations - the way they go flying through the air from explosions is perfect - with cute squeaky voices and funny little comments. The background music is happy tunes that match the level themes, all very pleasant.

[b]Customisation:[/b] you can rename your worms and there are many options for worm appearance (eg. moustaches, hats, comical specs), worm accents/phrases (eg. Angry Scot, Hostage, Wise Guy), level appearance etc. and as if there wasn't enough already you can download/create even more content with the workshop editor tool.

[b]Level overview:[/b] you can zoom in and out and mouse over the whole level to plan your strategy, spot enemies and places to hide etc.

[b]Overall quality:[/b] very slick and polished, charm and humour, loads of content, cross-platform.

[b]Performance:[/b] I have an i7, 8Gb RAM and midrange graphics (nVidia Geoforce GTX 550 Ti) and I had all video settings maxed. The offline gameplay is very smooth, no glitches. I've seen others complaining about framerates when there's a lot of activity on the screen but I haven't advanced far enough to experience that level of action yet so I can't comment on it. The online multiplayer is another matter.

[b]Value:[/b] after 12 hours I'm barely halfway through Story mode and the levels are already becoming pretty difficult, I'm having to make more and more attempts to get through. After that I can replay to improve my scores and climb the leaderboards which are based on time taken to complete levels. So all in all excellent value even without taking multiplayer into consideration.

[h1]Cons[/h1]

[b]No Linux controller support.[/b] This was a big disappointment for me and it's not mentioned anywhere on the store page. People have said that it doesn't work well with a controller anyway but I disagree, I tried it and it felt much more efficient and natural. However, no offence to Win users but for me playing games in Windows is like trying to enjoy a nice meal in an overcrowded, smoke-filled cafe surrounded by festering armpits and screaming, puking babies. I'll take the keyboard in Linux, thanks.

[b]Multiplayer:[/b] there's a full built-in system for finding individual matches and managing clans, both of which have leaderboards, so all the infrastructure is there. However, my experience of it was not ideal so if it's mainly multiplayer you're interested in then perhaps this one isn't for you. Personally I prefer the single-player campaigns anyway, I'm a puzzler at heart.

[b]Strange default keyboard hotkeys[/b] but a) you get used to them after a while and b) you can change them.

[b]Hidden game mechanic:[/b] telekinesis requires the tab key to turn the object. This is not explained anywhere, either in-game or on Google. I discovered it by trial and error. You're welcome.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

A fun, highly polished game with tons of content and a good learning curve. The Story mode will give you many hours of platform puzzling and then you can hone your strategic skills in online competition with your customised worms. It's not a cheap game but still good value for the quality and amount of content.

[quote][i]This review is part of the Steamified Community Review program. For similar reviews and fantastic giveaways please visit [url]http://steamified.com[/url].[/i][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197981769493', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1256, 'last_played': 1469022340}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063175694', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1467984208}
review:
Dear Team17, 
why are you still trying to fail in making a great game better with 3D and the exactly same gameplay. The low poly Landscapes feel boring, even with high settings the edges are unsharp, the music makes you fall asleep and the textures look like a 500% zoom onto some picture.

Can't you just try to add some gamemodes, worlds with physics and destruction or funny new weapons into some new worms game with a sharp and clear graphics style? I cannot see any reason to recommend this game and will never buy any new Worms as long as it is as boring as this one.


Anyway the idea of having a Macro-World in a Museum is great at least and the FX (even if they don't match the graphic style of the rest of the game) are nice, too.

review:
- physics are buggy sometimes
- you barley find somebody to play in online mode
- you can not add an A.I. player to an online game session
- nobody even plays the "Clan Wars" part of the game
- weapons don't feel as good in World Party or Armageddon.

It's still Worms and I will have fun playing it. 
But I'm overall pretty disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084889072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1467177235}
review: great fun, I've cried from laughing while playing this and I HONESTLY thought I was playing for like 3 hours.... but it was 8.1 in one sitting because i have no friends. At first I wasn't a big fan because I played the classic worms on the older consoles, but the game grew so much on me super fast, play the game as it is, then make game modes with stipulations and play with friends. Only thing I didn't like AT FIRST (meaning I do like it now) was the class based worms but they're not that hard to comprehend. Fat worm with more health more damage, small worm faster doesnt activate mines, genius worm heals and does genius shit, and the default worm. Mindless violence, and strategic gameplay, probably good for anybody 12 and up.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198126022752', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7661, 'last_played': 1658587986}
review:
I don't know why recent reviews are mixed 

This game is a great party of fun with friends, either you want to compete and win the match or just chill and laugh a lot.
It has good graphics, a variety of weapons and a level editor. I don't use the online play of this game a lot i only play with friends but i think it's a bit bugged.
So if you want to have a good time playing a game with your friends i would definitely recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170787571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1471174733}
review:
How can they keep getting it so wrong?

Before you even begin the game you're assaulted with the worst menu imaginable. It's a mess of clicking back and forth. So many clicks to access options that should be in one place. Basic UI design, or even testing the usuability should have addressed these issues. Why does each succesive Worms game have a worse and worse UI? It's been downhill since Worms 2. Like our thumbs have been growing non stop since the nineties. It looks like it's made for a touch screen interface, and probably was. PC versions should have PC interfaces.

I'm so vexxed about the UI I don't really even want to talk about the game. Back to Worms Armageddon!

review:

Poszczeg√≥lne typy robak√≥w zosta≈Çy bowiem bardziej zr√≥≈ºnicowane, a ich specjalizacje majƒÖ teraz znacznie wiƒôkszy wp≈Çyw na przebieg potyczki. ZnaczƒÖco usprawniono tak≈ºe silnik fizyczny oraz algorytmy sterujƒÖce zachowaniem przedmiot√≥w i wody. Rozgrywka wzbogacona zosta≈Ça dodatkowo rozbudowanymi opcjami spo≈Çeczno≈õciowymi. review:
The game looks visually atrocious with jagged edges around everything, I'm not normally the kind of person to complain about graphics, but the game just looks bad, even with anti-aliasing turned on, the game also runs at a terrible frame rate (generally hovering around 20fps) on a PC that easily meets the minimum required specs.

I am a huge fan of the Worms series but I unfortunately cannot recommend this game whatsoever due to the horrific visual problems this game has.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077538197', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1826, 'last_played': 1462052308}
review:
I don't understand how this awesome franchise went as down for their two last games.

First of all Clan Wars & Revolution are the exact same games! A real copy and past, even for the shitty bugs!

One of my favorite tool was the rope cause you could do really funny things with it, now you get stuck all the time and die because of that...
Ho yes, now you have the water! Yeah.. The water... Well this feature is to-ta-lly useless...

The 3D graphics did make sense in worms 3D, but in here there is absolutely no point to use it..

The bots are completely useless! I don't know how many turn I have waited 45sec to see the AI doing nothing at all!

The games modes are seen and seen again and again. Nothing really new.
They could have create new vs games with this awesome feature (the water) but I think they realized how shitty it was and did nothing with it...

Ho, and about the controls on a controller. Even this is totally wrong! The buttons mapping is totally TOTALLY NOT intuitive! I mean, jump with A? A?!! And fire with X? X?!!! That's the best way to mislead everyone!

The only good point is the story and the voice acting. It seams they spent all their money in it....


Anyway, I'm so disappointed with those games, I really miss the previous worms...
It a shame cause I really like this franchise, I have so many memories playing with friends. But recently it not fun anymore. It just kinda fun mixed with gameplay bugs & annoyance...

author: {'steamid': '76561198165561778', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1458211134}
review:
If you remember playing Worms years ago and thought that this is the new improved version with much better graphics and much more features you might be disappointed. It is rather fine but the weird multiplayer lobby makes it hard to get any opponents online unless you friend people who frequently play multiplayer matches.

The graphics are somewhat hideous, with blobs imitating water and 3d-ish models that lokk outdated.

The mechanics are so-so. The ninja rope is prone to blocking constantly, but other than that the combat is okay. 

Would I recommend this game? Yes, it's a fun part of the Worms series. There's a ton of weapons to choose from and a lot of customisation. The single player/tutorial part is rather short, but the story part long and fairly challenging.

Is it what I was expecting of it? Not even close. 

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197972297308', 'num_games_owned': 4440, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1456146067}
review:
I was playing Worms Clan Wars around the same time as I was playing Worms Revolution, so I will mainly compare this game to that one.

[b]Worms Clan Wars has:[/b]
- [b]Fewer (and easier) single player missions.[/b]
- [b]Worse AI.[/b] The enemy worms kill themselves half the time. Some people were complaining that the AI in Worms Revolution was way too skilled, but I'd prefer that over this idiot AI any time.
- [b]More annoying (and less funny) narrator[/b], although this probably is a matter of taste.
- [b]Game-breaking bugs.[/b] Some levels can't be completed and you have to do them all over again from the start, possibly even multiple times until you figure out what causes the bug.
- [b]Crashes.[/b]
- [b]A higher price.[/b]

Overall:
Don't buy this game unless you have already finished Worms Revolution and just want to do some more single player missions (that you might have to redo several times).

review:
its a good game with great new perks, its simular to the classic worms which i like, Also you have the choice to make/join a clan, However even tho this is probably the best worms game to buy and play on single player .

However it can be extremely difficult to find a online game, Luckily i have a few mates who own the game as well so we can play multiplayer games whenever we like.

New features include water bombs and a few other water weapons which i really enjoy using as i flood the shit out of the map making worms meet their makers

author: {'steamid': '76561198018640959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2061, 'last_played': 1488656608}
review:
Es ist und bleibt eines der besten Spiele wenn man sich einfach mal die Zeit vertreiben will! Das erste mal spielte ich Worms Armagedon in jungen Jahren. Bis hier hin haben sich viele Dinge ver√§ndert und ich h√§tte auch noch ein paar Verbesserungsvorschl√§ge, wenn es zum Beispiel ums Spielsetup handelt. Ich bem√§ngele auch die mickrigen einstellungen was das Clan Wars Web Portal betrift, z.B. das man keinen Clan suchen kann indem man den Namen eingibt. Au√üerdem habe ich dem mittlerweile schon einem Monat wo ich das Spiel habe nie ein Teammitglied gesehen. Ich denke es ist nicht gut einen Verdienst auszuschreiben f√ºr eine Sache die sp√§ter keiner nutzt. Man muss ja auch kritisch sein. Trotzdem sage ich das es mein Lieblingsspiel ist. Damals waren es mal die Silver Games Editionen oder golden Games Editionen, heute spiele ich auf Steam. Also mir gef√§llts, fairer Preis und einigerma√üen kurze Wartezeiten...
See you in Worms, Servus!!!

review:
Worms Clan Wars is a really great game to play with friends, the integration of the Steam Workshop means that it's more hilarious than ever. Over the week that I've had it I've already racked up 14 hours on this game and counting. I'd really recommend it if you're a casual player or you just want to mess around with friends. It's not amazingly optimised truth be told but it makes up for it with a Campaign that teaches you about all those weapons you never really knew what the hell they did. 

If you're on the fence, I'd say go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980058119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1451753589}
review:
Ziemlich entt√§uschend. Ich hatte gehofft ein gutes "altes" Wormsspiel zu bekommen, aber was hier geliefert wurde ist eher mit "naja, eher net so geil", zu beschreiben. 
Das Wormsfeeling ist da, das ist ein guter Punkt.
Was mich jedoch st√∂rt ist:
- Bei einigen Karten ists sehr schwer zu erkennen was Background ist und was nicht (zumindest als blutiger Anf√§nger)
- Hitboxen: Ich finds schrecklich, wie die W√ºrmer an Kanten h√§ngen- bzw. Steckenbleiben. Das Ninjaseil war damals (Worms 2 und Armageddon) sau geil, jetzt ists ne Qual, damit gescheit zu schwingen und zu arbeiten.
- Bugs: Sorry wenn ein Objekt auf einen f√§llt und mal keinen DMG macht oder manchmal bugy zuckelt und solange auf den Wurm f√§llt, bis er tot ist, ist das ein no go!

Ein schlechter Wormsteil, diese Steuerung und Hitboxen gehen mir richtig auf die Nerven. Es f√ºhlt sich nicht rund an und kommt mir vor, als wenn man schnell ein 0 8 15 Game geschustert hat, statt sich M√ºhe zu geben um einen tollen Titel zu erstellen.

review:
Ein Multiplayerspiel was seines gleichen sucht. Was in Mariokart blaue Panzer sind, sind in Worms bananabombs und esel und holygrenades und superschafe und und und... Na gut an die Steuerung muss vorerst gew√∂hnen und eigentlich bassiert das spiel zu 90% auf Gl√ºck. Trotzdem macht es mit ein paar Freunden Riesen Spa√ü und man hat immer Zeit f√ºr ne kleine partie. 
Das Beste: Man kann wie in alten Zeiten zu viert an einem Pc daddeln und erlebt die wutausbr√ºche wenn ein armagedon einschl√§gt live zuhause :D
8,5/10   Was kann man da f√ºr den Preis falsch machen?? Vorallen wenn man in der theorie nur ein Spiel f√ºr 4 Personen braucht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150675310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1450529170}
review:
Bought the game because I am a long-time fan of the Worms series.  I figured that a 2013 edition of the game would be bigger and better.  Boy was I mistaken.

My PC is a potato.  I recognize that.  But I can't understand how and why this game runs so poorly, particularly since the "3D" aspects of the game are quite tame.  Input lag.  Poor frame rates.  Terrible optimizations.  Even the cursor moves around on the selection menus with a delay, resulting in misclicks at every turn.  I get that I can't run the latest AAA titles, but thereis no excuse for how terribly this game runs.  This smacks of a terrible console port.

The new control configuration is also terrible.  I don't really understand what was wrong with the original control setup.  Someone decided to reinvent the wheel, and this new wheel does not roll.

This, like all other worms games that attempt to go 3D, is an unmitigated disaster.  Worms is best in 2D and IMO it should stay that way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977087560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1454273782}
review:
Team17 had recently a lot of downtime of their servers for Worms Clan Wars.
It was very frustrating not being able to start a mutliplayer match even all players were ready.
A few days later, everything works again and online multiplayer fights are fully functional.
So in case this happens again: yes it sucks, but give it some time, try some days later again, it's worth it.

Worms Clan Wars is a classical Worms-Game from Team17 like the early versions back in the childhood.
Still the cool old weapons like holy hand grenade, the Grandma Fart or the concrete donkey - but also plenty of new weapons.
Its awesome to play it with friends - Consider buying a cheap 4-pack of the game. More friends having a copy of the game - more fun. I would recommend to wait buying it until a sale with a good discount offers this game, because the standard price is way too much. 

All in all: Awesome game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055106792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1449416108}
review: Who even plays this Game? I mean i wait 1 hour to join a match but those people dont even click to make theirself green so its an forever going waiting process. The day i bought it, i thought its worth the 3 euro, but its not even 1 euro worth it.. Not worth my time. Just playing offline is boring as hell. The game is full of the polish force no wonder why we need to wait forever, dont want to be racist but i was not even once able to join a game since i bought this Game. I wonder why so many people enjoy this game. I personaly didnt enjoy any moment in this Game. The offline gameplay is just poorly and online like i said not working. Thank you whoever made this Game... Many People will say now:" then why did you buy it?" or " Why dont you refund?" I thought its a good game with competend people and i dont refund because the money i would get is just not worth my time. Dislike this review or whatever. This is my personal Review about this Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098138406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1449943507}
review: They tried to reinvent a classic with 3d graphics on a 2d game. And horribly failed. This is just Worm-3d-bad. The overall grafic effect is painful for my eyes and so unoptimized it's going to stress your CPU and you. Maybe you could get used to that but I uninstalled it and tagget it "Never More" in my library before this could happen. "Worms Reloaded" is nothing new but it works, if you love the classic game, go for it.

review:
Why did I buy Worms Clan Wars and not Worms Reloaded? This is so much worse... It's 3D, looks ugly, very laggy and slow on my laptop (even on LOW settings), although I can run, for example, Crysis WARHEAD perfectly fine :( It's so laggy that most of the time it processes double Shift (back flip) as single Shift (forward jump) and my worms simply jump into water. Can I replace this with much more classic-looking, 2D Worms Reloaded? :)
UPD: Oh, and did I mention that Worms World Party or Worms Armageddon are still the best? Hell, even Hedgewars is 10 times better than this (serioursly, try them out).

author: {'steamid': '76561198023619499', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1465061246}
review:
Game is awesome! I don't remember when I had so much fun and when I laughed soo haaard - funny situations, epic fails, funny kills.

I like idea of 4 classes of worms - each class has pros and cons.

Dynamic items or map (f.e. statue can be pushed or bally thing can be rolled, etc)

Soundtrack is very good, I am positive suprised.

One con is that multiplayer was broken for 2 days, but it's understardable - there was Humble Bundle and Steam Sale, servers just gone down - BUT devs reacted on forums and restarted WORMNET servers - so multiplayer IS WORKING there. I think they will restart quick unranked matches servers too, so it will be fixed. On Wormnet you can play unranked too, so don't worry :)

review: I absolutly love this game. It is much more fun with a group of friends than alone, but either way you will not regret this buy. I would play more if my friends would. I actually think the best part of the game is the mistakes people and I make. They are so funny.

review:
[strike]The multiplayer serves as a chat room.
YES , you're reading it right. A CHAT ROOM.
People come in the lobby..Everyone is ready...READY TO CHAT.
The game won't start.
We always end up talking about how we wasted our money on this game.

10 out of 10
Very nice chat room. Better than any other social media. Will invite more friends.[/strike]

EDIT: It's a miracle that the servers are working fine now. That means the game will start automatically when everyone is ready. Enjoy :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197992752428', 'num_games_owned': 2145, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1648319975}
review:
Un peu d√©√ßu de cet opus, l'√©valuation faite suite √† un crash en pleine checkpoint qui m'a fait perdre l'avancement dans la campagne (2 heures de jeu) cela n'agu√®re rien de bon sur la technnique. 
On va commencer par cette derni√®re, sachant que la premi√®re fois que j'ai jou√© √† la plupart des jeux de la s√©rie, sauf les d√©riv√©s qui ne m'ont jamais int√©ress√©s. Depuis le passage √† la 3D les missions sont devenues beaucoup simple et avec un sc√©nario plus pouss√© qui donne envie d'aller jusqu'au bout. 

En terme de jouabilit√©, il n'apporte pas grand chose par rapport √† Revolution qui a √©t√© comme le premier √©pisode en 3D une claque en terme de changement avec les diff√©rentes classes de soldat, la gestion des fluides, par contre l'acc√®s au workshop est un petit plus. 

Graphquement le jeu n'est pas mauvais, par contre l'√©rgonomie est d√©sastreuse, le multijoueur est vide du fait que Team17 transforme en Call of Worms Creed avec un √©pisode au moins par an. 

Par contre essayez Hedgewars c'est un clone libre de Worms qui est particuli√®rement bien optimis√© et tr√®s dr√¥le √† jouer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980493869', 'num_games_owned': 754, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1449862342}
review:
Day 1, multiplayer doesn't work.
Day 2, multiplayer doesn't work.
Day 3, multiplayer doesn't work.
Day 4, multiplayer works! Let's get into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023766021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2544, 'last_played': 1676134483}
review:
Imagine if you loved marmite one day, then despised it the next, breaking all the rules. That's how Worms Clan Wars is for me.

On the one hand, the artistic maps with dynamic water provide a highly involving environment on which a remixed version of the classic worms gameplay can take place. Moving worms about with water - particularly small bodies of water released from high terrain, sweeping worms to their doom or at least discomfort - has proved very entertaining, much as it did in Worms Revolution. The weapons are exceedingly well balanced with just one major exception, though even that (the Concrete Donkey, of course) is more challenging to use now due to realistic interaction with the terrain. I'm impressed how tricky it is to make use of some of the most powerful weapons, for example it's rare to be able to get a lot out of the Old Woman unless on a very basic landscape with some long, gradually sloped or flat sections.

The darkside to the game involves somewhat dodgy physics when attempting to move about. For the most part, things are alright, but every now and then a worm will get caught on a small, pretty much invisible speck of land and this can ruin attempts to cross decent distances with a single jump or rope swing. Speaking of the rope, that really can be a nightmare, as for some reason it tends to get caught on bits of land very easily, forcing you to release and try another shot (if you have one). Not only that but it has a notoriously unreliable 'up and over' feature, which sees a worm that has pulled the rope all the way in to the land attempt to spring up from the rope to get into a ledge. It's about 50/50 whether the worm will make it or not, and if not - and this is the real troublemaker - the fact that the worm makes contact with land removes its ability to shoot out a new rope and save itself. All too often this results in a worm sliding into deep water or off the map entirely. Brilliant blow-by-blow standoffs have come to an unjust end as one player attempted to relocate just a short distance for a more strategic bazooka launching position.

Overall though, the game has entertained me enough to keep me coming back, despite a bit of lag due to the game's minimum requirements being a bit higher than the specs given in the store (trust me - I've tried turning all the options down to their lowest).

While I'm at this I may as well add that I feel the game would have greatly benefitted from the inclusion of a couple weapons in particular; the mail strike (a tactical wind-affected strike for which I always enjoy watching the different items of mail affect each others paths in Worms Armaggedon) and the Ming Vase (a cluster weapon dropped like dynamite that was good for blasting away several layers of land in W:A - making it a great tactical weapon despite being 'super'). This is, of course, a matter of personal opinion and does not affect the rating for this game that I am giving, which is:

7/10

So I do reccomend this game provided your PC/Laptop exceeds the minimum specs slightly (e.g. at least 4GB RAM) and/or you are willing to set the various game options to the minimum .

author: {'steamid': '76561197980514994', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1449351985}
review:
Pros: 
Great fun. Many improvements over worms reloaded and the bugs from that game are not present. Interesting variety of weapons and the AI has been improved. Graphics have been improved too.  Lots of customization options.

You can choose between different worms to have in your team. Scientists for example heal nearby friendly worms, scouts can move faster and don't set off mines, soldiers make a huge explosion when they die, etc. This adds a bit more strategy.

Cons: 
Online multiplayer is deserted. I could not find a clan or a ranked online match with people. You will most likely need to play this with IRL friends. This is a multiplayer game!! 
There should have been more out-of-the-box variety in landscape art. 

Neutral: 
The music is only OK. It could be better.

Careful: 
This game may not have cross platform support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051283774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1269, 'last_played': 1508963548}
review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Gameplay has improved since I last played a game of Worms, but the core gameplay is the same. Some weapons has been added into the game, but most of the classic weapons is still there. You are basically worms with weapons killing the other worms. The last worm alive wins. There is a good amount of strategy in the game, which makes it a fun and a challenging game. The multiplayer is quite excellent too. As the name suggest, you can now form clans to create the ultimate team. The game also features a singleplayer campaign, which is heavily underrated. There is also a lot of customization, you can change anything from how your worms speak, to what clothes they are wearing and a lot of maps in the workshops. 

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The has been modernized enough to keep it classic for nolstagic fans as well as newcomers. Worms has always been a cute-killing game. There is also a lot of depth in the levels and interesting map design. Too bad they are not as memomable as the earlier games.

[h1]Sound[/h1]
All the guns sounds satisfying, especially the explosions. The voices the Worms makes when they die are hilarious too. 

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
Worms Clan Wars is an excellent party game, and with the brilliant multiplayer it makes it even more easy to pick up and play. [i]It is worms, guys! What else can I say?![/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198160433325', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1446671767}
review:
I have always had a soft spot for the Worm's series, which it's crazy physics, bazookas, dynamite, super sheep and holy hand grenades and this game hasn't changed that opinion one bit. I took advantage of the package deal and got this Worms game along with several others. Note this is a first impression review.

Worms Clan Wars is an 2.5D artillery game where you control teams of Worms to defeat the other teams. You use a wide selection of weaponry and tools to secure victory. Sometimes in hilarious ways. Gameplay wise this is no Armaggedon but it comes close.

Even when you lose or do something daft you can always laugh about it. In one case, I was going to do a classic tactic of using a baseball bat to send an enemy worm into the water, only instead for the worm to catch onto a piece of landscape, I was still laughing afterwards.

Unlike most Worms games including Armaggedon, you have several classes of Worms to use. The Soldier is basically the standard Worm, but gains the ability to detonate grenades at any time. The Scout is a weaker, but faster Worm that doesn't set of mines. The Heavy is a slow, but tough worm that does extra damage. The Scientist is similar to the Solider but can heal itself and its teammate each turn whilst producing better tools. You can configure your team to adapt to this.

Online Gameplay is fun, and even when something daft happens you can still enjoy it and the clan features are nice.

The only criticism I have is the modded in cosemtic options, which with some items like that Master Chief helmet can really cause the lag in an online game to go theough the roof and with a rather low spec computer it has firced me to quit several times.

Definately recommend giving this game a shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000914865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1630900364}
review:
I was alive when the first Worms came out and this latest flavour is decent. I play it with a friend through Steam, which is very well integrated and quick to jump in.

If you are a fan of Worms games, this one will not dissappoint. It's still just Worms, but the game runs smoothly, the graphics are good, the silly comedy is still there and blowing you friends away in this game never gets old!

Only complaint, if at all, the price is a bit high, but get it on sale and you'll get a great value buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965940511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1443854118}
review: Worms is in line with the previous games, a 2D team-based arcade arena, and their humour is par for the course, along with the weapons, stages, etc. Clan wars is a great little title to play with friends, the updated interface and 3D graphics are nicely done, customization is high, with mod support to boot, and I've gotten more than a couple laughs and good entertainment already. If you like dicking around with your friends with mayhem and well placed mechanics and overall gameplay, this works great. I'm not sure about solo, or the full price point at the moment, but I'd say worth a sale price.

review:
Worms Clan Wars to kontynuacja znanej serii robaczk√≥w. Jak ka≈ºde Worms'y polega na wyko≈Ñczenia robaczk√≥w przeciwnika i prze≈ºycie samemu. Gra jest przyjemna rozgrywka te≈º. Mo≈ºna pograƒá ze znajomymi, jak i z nieznanymi graczami z ca≈Çego ≈õwiata. Mamy du≈ºo map, kostium√≥w, broni i tryb√≥w do wybory, W grze sƒÖ 4 rodzaje robaczk√≥w do wyboru. Jedyne wady produkcji to beznadziejna konfiguracja gry, ≈ºeby pograƒá na 100 FPS'ach trza mieƒá kompa za min. 5 ty≈õ. DrugƒÖ wadƒÖ tej produkcji jest monotonno≈õƒá map, prawie wszystkie wyglƒÖdajƒÖ tak samo. Polecam ludziom, kt√≥rzy majƒÖ dobry sprzƒôt i sƒÖ fanami robaczkowych wojen.

Grafika: 10/10 ≈Åadna, lu≈∫na i przyjemna dla oka.

Audio: 10/10 ≈Åadna muzyczka, a efekty d≈∫wiƒôkowe te≈º fajne sƒÖ.

Zabawa: 8/10 Lag'i lag'i i jeszcze raz lag'i, reszta nie przeszkadza w przyjemnej zabawie.

Multiplayer: 7/10 Po≈ÇƒÖczenia zostajƒÖ zerwane bardzo czƒôsto, trzeba mieƒá dobrego i stabilnego neta, plus ludzie bywajƒÖ totalnymi noob'ami, co czasem denerwuje.

Ocena og√≥lna: 7/10 Gdyby nie beznadziejna konfiguracja i lag'i na serwerach gry by≈Çoby 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021500136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1436999661}
review:
Clan Wars is probably the most innovative Worms game to date offering the same diversity of classes as Revolution albeit with some tweaks for balancing.

In case you're not familiar with them: 
[list]
[*] Soldiers are the same regular worms from all other games except they can choose when to detonate grenades. 
[*] Heavies have the most damage and biggest explosions but are slower and (obviously) heavier. 
[*] Scouts are more mobile with longer jumps and are light enough to avoid triggering mines but deal less damage.
[*] Scientists heal friendly worms in a small radius at the start of their turn and all constructions (girders, turrets, magnets, etc.) are more durable but they also deal reduced damage.
[/list]
Weapons variety is largely the same as in Revolution from the traditional bazooka to some of the more wacky ones, many of which have multiple uses, like the Lightning Strike allowing you to heal worms, resurrect dead ones, convert turrets and activate inactive mines and magnets. Unlike classic Worms and Armageddon the Ninja Rope functions more like a rope than a mix between a rope and a ladder, meaning you'll weigh it down and have to use your momentum to swing around. Other mobility items, both old and new to the genre, include such items as Jetpack, Water Jetpack and Teleport Gun to name but a few.

As far as gameplay goes Clan Wars is an optimized Revolution meaning no lag when water sloshes about. However, both games are made in the same engine which limits animations to 30 frames per second regardless of what fps the actual game runs on. Note the game itself can run above 30 fps; only the worm animations are limited.

So all in all I think it's one of the freshest Worms games out there since Armageddon.

review:
Worms Clan Wars ist ein ziemlich lustiges Spiel, indem man (am besten mit seinen Freunden) gegeneinander spielt und versucht, die anderen W√ºrmer zu t√∂ten. Der Clan Wars Modus, in dem man, wie der Name schon sagt, einen Clan hat, in dem man zusammen mit einem anderen Spieler des Clans gegen zwei Spieler aus einem anderen Clan k√§mpft, ist zwar ganz nett gemacht, allerdings benutze ich diesen kaum.

Insgesamt, ein gutes Spiel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000735363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1531068079}
review:
This is without doubt the most hilarious game I've ever played. Never tried online-multiplayer and I don't plan on it either but if you have two or three friends to play with you will definitely have a good time.

Can't say it is a game to play for hours straight but those few matches, only lasting minutes, in between watching series and shooting motherfuckers in csgo is something I've begun to look forward to. For its fullprice at 22eur I can't say it's worth for a cheap guy, but no person shall ever find this game boring.

If you have played any other worms games then you know what the deal is but I cant guarantee this one is the new shit since Armageddon. Really.

8/10 or smthn whereas the last 2pieces are missing due to poor(or hardmanipulated) settings and graphicbugs without understanding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148673955', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2567, 'last_played': 1528494468}
review:
[h1]Worms Clan Wars[/h1]

[list][u]Pros:[/u]

[*]Single-player mode
[*]Online and local multiplayer
[*]Tons of customization
[*]Tons of unique weapons
[*]Randomly generated stages
[*]Clan wars - 2v2 matches.  Different then the normal free-for-all Worms games
[*]A great amount of replay value
[*]Steam Workshop

[u]Cons:[/u]
[*]Hard to find matches online (not many players)
[*]Only 5 worlds
[*]Single-player mode is boring
[*]Worm classes


[b]8.3 / 10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198040927876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1439102617}
review:
For a long time I've been waiting for Team 17 to release a working version of Worms World Party that was compatible with a version of Windows beyond 98. I don't really think thats ever going to happen because Team 17 insist that Armageddon reaches feature paritywith WWP before thats possible, and they no longer work on that game.

So, this game is pretty close. It doesn't seem to run that well on my ATI hardware (my computer is fairly rubbish anyway), but its pretty good in terms of being somewhere between the Armageddon kit and the WWP kit. The physics feel pretty spot on. I don't know if thats good or bad, considering the cartoonish tone, but as a whole it all seems to knit quite well. 

Its true that the backgrounds confuse the foregrounds a little, but moving the mouse around tends to resolve the confusion. The museum set idea is cool, and the narrator is quite droll (funny), but the water (bottom border) is a really crappy texture/surface that is entirely unbelievable, particularly in context of the museum set.

I'd give it a 7/10 production value, but as usual, with a Worms game, the real value is in having someone to laugh at your incompetence in trying to kill them. The game seems to do that exceptionally well, and allows hot seat, so it gets atleast one more point for longevity. The online component is deserted, but LAN and hotseat is what this game as always done best anyway. Its an underated gem in the Worms series.

review:
This is one of the most entertaining and challenging real time strategy type games I've played in a long time.  You will undoubtably kill your own worms many times before mastering their attacks and movement.  And that is part of the hilarity of it all.

Overall I give this game 9/10.  The deduction of one point is because I think the worms have a little too much gas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028606450', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1392160741}
review:
This is the first new Worms game I played since Worms 3D, and maybe my memories of the older generations of 2D Worms games have been filtered through nostalgia, but I just remember World Party as much better than this game. The third dimension adds practically nothing to this game, in fact, the game would probably have looked better with high resolution 2D environments instead. The worms have a terrible knack of constantly getting stuck in terrain, even more so than in older installments.

The online rooms are almost devoid of life, maybe because Team17 choose to release new Worms games so close that the community can't keep up support for them. The single player campaign is not very good at all. All the missions have you drudging through linear levels full of annoying mechanisms for your worms to get stuck in. The AI, by the way, hasn't improved at all in the 12 years since World Party either.

I'm not sure about the introductions of specialized classes, it's all right I guess. The only new thing I really enjoy is the water mechanics. That's not enough. It's disappointing, but I could rather just reinstall World Party and play hotseat than keep playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145172494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2852, 'last_played': 1446001619}
review:
I got the four pack with some suitemates in my dorm and might I say this was well worth the 4-odd dollars I had to pay per copy. Among the four of us we had collectively broken 100 hours within the first two weeks.

DOWNSIDE: 
If you can't find friends to play, it can be hard to find a match with more than one opponent. Not enough Clans play and I feel people are really missing out.

UPSIDE:
This game series is and always fun, and this game is no different.
Clan Wars uses four different characters with different movement speeds and damage outputs, and you can have any combination you want... keeping things interesting.
There's always new workshop content such as soundboards, worm outfits, and maps.
Playing with friends is hilarious, especially when that one friend you have that is terrible at these games keeps accidentally committing suicide while parachuting or jetpacking. Alliances will be made, betrayed, and winning is always a curse.
Half 3D maps are visually satisfying and destruction is... a "blast"
Dynamic water/Good weapon choice/physics objects
Not strenuous on your pc

Overall, it's a great game and made better with friends.
I've even considered buying extra copies to get more people playing, but my wallet disagrees...

Get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087062262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1535989231}
review:
being a long time worms fan, I was hoping for a refined and well executed entry. After all, it is basically the same game as previous installments, so you would think they would have got it right by now... unfortuntaly, not quite.
But first, I quite liked the idea of different worm varieties. there are worms that heal themselves and worms around them on their turn, worms that jump and move faster and worms that explode harder when they... die? and they have reduced movement speed, jumping ability and has less jetpack fuel? sure, okay.
It allows for some neat gameplay strategies and adds a well needed extra layer of tactics to worm matches. the physics water is also a neat feature, if not vastly overpowered, especially when using water based weaponry that can make worms slip and drown in the actual 'water' water.
While it's not a bad game, it has many little issues that really hold the game back. The weapons are a little unbalanced and inconsistant. I have never been able to accurately tell how much damage a weapon is going to do: a bazooka hit directly may do 30 damage, or 50. I have never been able to find out why it does this, but it is very infuriating because it puts an extra layer of doubt when planning attacks because you don't know what the move will accomplish: it may destroy a worm or simply critically wound it.
The UI is also an issue. for starters, the aiming reticule is much too big and inaccurate: I would have much preferred a simple dotted line and a small crosshair rather than the over-produced whacky one it has. playing multiplayer has some strange quirks with matchmaking too: you can't start a new game with a player in the same session, you have to back out of a session entirely and start a new one. It is uncesscesarily finicky and awkward.
The singleplayer is also dissapointing. I find it funny that they expect you to go through tutorial stages. I mean it's only been 18 freaking games, I think I got the gist of it by now! I would have liked the option to skip those levels. The narrator (definatly NOT a laura croft spoof) is also a tad annoying, but that is subjective, you may enjoy it. needless to say I do not. otherwise, the singleplayer campaign is just a string of battles with objectives thrown in, usual fair. nothing special at all.
Overall it's a very mediocure entry to the series that feels very unpolished and undercooked. For what it's worth though, despite it's problems, I had fun playing it with mates. If you are willing to overlook it's flaws, it's still at it's core a worms game. But even saying that, there have better worms games before this. Just get Worms: Armageddon Instead.

review:
Garbage. The mechanics are so sluggish and slow, not the pace required for worms at all. Also, rope mechanics and such are totally ruined thanks to the new physics engine-even Super Sheep are rubbish.

DO NOT BUY, I bought it on sale and it was a waste of my money.
Team17 should go back to Worms 2/Armaggeddon/World Party and start from there if they're doing 2d plan worms again, their new attempts are just pitiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050554156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1481061340}
review:
This is one of the newer versions of worms. It features 3D model based graphics, multiple Worm types and significant appearance customization.

Good online gameplay but players are not abundant so you will not find online players any time of the week, but you can still find at certain times of the day and on weekends.

Also, this is one of those games that always cheers me up.

review: I have never played worms before, but I have seen videos of it and it looks very fun; however after buying this game I couldn't get into a single online game.  I am very dissapointed that there is never anyone online.  The single player is pretty boring and runs on pretty low FPS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035297348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1423280101}
review:
*I have not played other versions such as revolution, nor do I play any sort of single player mode.  I play this with friends online.That being said, we have fun with it.  

If you can get it cheap and you don't already have other versions of the game then it is worth getting.  It is a turn-based game (turns are timed, so watch out) where you try to knock out your opponents.  The wide variety of weapons are not complex, but you can make them more effective with proper strategy.  Multi-player seems relatively smooth and the variety of maps has lead us to play this game over and over again.  A single round is reletively quick.  We play this game while we chat or while waiting on other people to show up to play more time intensive games.  It seems to be playable by a wide experience range.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998773543', 'num_games_owned': 1686, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1427750776}
review:
Die grunds√§tzlich schlechten Wertungen kann ich nur teilweise nachvollziehen. Auf der einen Seite: Klar, es kommt nicht an die √úbersichtlich- und Einfachheit der "echten" 2D-Vorg√§nger, insbesondere "Armageddon" mit Patches, ran. Aber von allen 3D-Teilen, inklusive "Reloaded", ist "Worms Clan Wars" die beste Reinkarnation der W√ºrmer. Wer sich zwischen Reloaded, Revolution und Clan Wars entscheiden will, macht mit Clan Wars meiner Meinung nach die beste Wahl... Wem Grafik und nicht vorhandene Gamepad-Unterst√ºtzung egal ist, macht hingegen mit Armageddon immernoch den gr√∂√üten Gl√ºcksgriff...

Team17 hatte mit dem Zeitpunkt der Ver√∂ffentlichung von Clan Wars einfach Pech: Erst gabs mit Reloaded einen Schritt in die richtige Richtung f√ºr alte Fans, nur um sich mit Revolution vollends wieder von der Fanbasis zu entfernen: Statt der 8 geforderten W√ºrmer pro Team gabs weiterhin nur 4, das ideale Tempo wurde gedrosselt, stattdessen wurden Klassen eingef√ºhrt, die aber das Spielgeschehen mangels darauf ausgerichteter Karten kaum beeinflusst haben. Leidlich witzige Cutscenes wurden eingebaut und DLCs mit Waffenpacks verkauft... Kurzum: Alles f√ºhlte sich schlechter an. S√§mtliche alteingesessene Fans, die sich Revolution kauften, waren bitter entt√§uscht, weil Team17 mit Revolution genau den entgegengesetzten Weg ging.

Warum ich das schreibe? Weil ich glaube, dass das die √ºberwiegend negativen Rezensionen von Clan Wars erkl√§ren k√∂nnte: Nach Revolution wollte ich von Worms auch nichts mehr wissen, nichtmal in einem 5‚Ç¨-Deal, weil ich dachte, Team17 geht weiterhin nicht auf die Community zu. Erst, als ich von Spielern Anderes h√∂rte, schlug ich zu: Team17 hat tats√§chlich aus den Fehlern von Revolution gelernt: Endlich gibts wieder 8 W√ºrmer pro Team, die dreisten DLCs wurde durch die Steam-Workshop-Integration ausgetauscht, Individualisierungsoptionen gibts nun wieder en Masse. Die Landschaften k√∂nnen gr√∂√üer und vielf√§ltiger konfiguriert werden als jemals zuvor. Die Musik ist sogar wieder an den alten Melodien der 2D-Vorg√§nger angelehnt. Team17 hat "nur" den Fehler gemacht, w√§hrend der Ver√∂ffentlichung niemandem was davon zu sagen. Ich verstehe nicht, warum; h√§tte ich von den Verbesserungen vorher gewusst, h√§tte ich diesen Worms-Teil vermutlich sogar zum Releasezeitpunkt gekauft gehabt. Wenn man sieht, wie schlecht sich Clan Wars verkauft hat, war ich wohl nicht der einzige, der so gedacht hat...

Auf alle F√§lle, um nochmal die Essenz meiner Review rauszuziehen: Wer die "echten" 2D-Teile nicht spielen will, macht mit Clan Wars meiner Meinung nach die beste Wahl aller "Pseudo-3D"-Worms-Teile. Wer auch mit den "echten" 2D-Teilen keine Probleme hat, sollte lieber zu "Armageddon" greifen, der spielerisch der beste Worms-Teil ist, aber leider keine Gamepad-Unterst√ºtzung bietet...

author: {'steamid': '76561197993882806', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1444000936}
review:
Erstmal vorweg: Ich bin noch ein Anh√§nger des alten Worms 2 Spiels, besitze selbst Worms Armageddon und Worms: Revolution. Dazu bin ich nur Gelegenheitsspieler und erhebe keinen besonderen Anspruch am Worms, da es f√ºr mich nur um zocken mit Freunden und um knifflige Kampangen geht.

Zu den Pros:
+ Steamworkshop (wirklich gut gelungen, auch wenn das Importieren nur nach einem Neustart funktioniert)
+ Wasser (ein neues taktisches Element, kann W√ºrmer wegsp√ºlen/ertr√§nken f√ºr 5 Schaden pro Runde)
+ Online Unsterst√ºtzung (theoretisch ben√∂tigt man kein Hamachi o.√§. mehr)
+ Clan Funktion (Man kann einen Clan gr√ºnden/beitreten und auf einer Tabelle via Matchmaking nach oben klettern)

-+ Neue Optik (Sieht zwar nett aus, aber f√ºr den Preis hab ich Spiele gesehn die besser dastehen)
-+ Pseudo 3D (Kanten auf denen man steht kann man nicht mehr erkennen und Klippingfehler bringen so manchen W√ºrmern den Tod)

- Preisleistung (hab das Spiel im Angebot gekauft ca. 5‚Ç¨ statt 20‚Ç¨, 20‚Ç¨ h√§tte ich nicht daf√ºr gezahlt, 5‚Ç¨ sind noch ertr√§glich)
- Multiplayer (Jeder wichtige Worms-Titel l√§sst es zu mit Freunden gegen Computer spielen zu lassen, hier fehlt es)
- Multiplayer (Mal eben mit 2 Freunden spielen via Internet? Viel zu umst√§ndlich muss man eine Lobby f√ºr das Spiel √∂ffnen und darauf achten schnell genug beizutreten oder die Teamgr√∂√üe passen einzurichten oder man hat Randombobs im Team)

Fazit: H√§tte gut werden k√∂nnen, leider fehlen Eintsellungen f√ºr die Waffen (st√§rke usw.), die Grafik h√§tte zeitgem√§√üer ausfallen k√∂nnen, w√ºrde im vergleich zu Worms:Reloaded(2010 u. 20‚Ç¨) trotz der Funktionen sehr viel schlechter ausfallen. M√ºsste ich das Spiel f√ºr 20‚Ç¨ kaufen, w√ºrd ich kotzen.

PS.: Das Ninja-Seil ist 1. H√§sslich 2. Unzuverl√§ssig 3. Ein verbessertes Bungee-Seil
Ich sch√ºttle nur den Kopf, vorallem weil sie es ja schonmal besser konnten (ja Team17 ihr habt euch keine zeit f√ºr das Spiel genommen, aber auch verst√§ndlich wenn man fast jedes Jahr ein Worms f√ºr das Handy/Pc raushaut, da h√§tte ich auch keine Zeit was gutes zu zaubern, vorallem wenn ich schon viel praktische erfahrung und eine gro√üe fangemeinde hat die man ausschlachten kan ;) )

author: {'steamid': '76561198141983663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1425773913}
review:
I am really disappointed. The graphics and the reviews sounded OK, so i bought the game. It was not _that_ cheap, so i have to warn the people. I am a fan of Worms, i think the Armageddon is the best for PC. I have a good PC, so my experience with this game has nothing to do with my config or drivers.

What i really disliked: 
 - horrible input lag, around 500ms !
 - bad visuals
 - auto-scrolling is stuttering, with or without vsync on...
 - stupid story...who needs it in a Worms game ?!

Positive things:
 - i can't really mention, if you really want to play Worms you should get the Armageddon.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198019458907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1431630905}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055338667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 2135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1277, 'last_played': 1621738587}
review:
While the community is not as lively as it could or should be, and prior entries to the season (such as Armageddon) are going strong to this day; as a whole, Worms Clan Wars may be the best 2D Worms title yet. Expanding on Revolution's physics-based combat, especially dynamic water, this is a game that requires a change in strategy from say, Worms Reloaded. For example, in Worms Clan Wars, when a grenade is thrown anywhere that is not completely flat land, it rolls. Typically in an older Worms title, grenades would not be nearly as affected by gravity. This makes combat either much easier, or much harder, depending on how you are at the game. Either way, it requires a bit of getting used to.

Clan Wars' strength lies in its customization. While Mac users are out of luck currently regarding the Steam Workshop, everyone has open access to the in-game level editor, which is excellent and very easy to use thanks to a selection of brush and line tools which make precise editing simple.

Unfortunately this is a game, and an entire series that shines with its multiplayer; but the community is lacking, as of now. So, unless you have friends to play with, you may want to get Armageddon instead.

If that's not an issue, by all means buy this. Especially on its current $6 sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978197359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1456332302}
review:
Game looks like it would be a lot of classic worms fun but I never got that far as the game runs with such terrible performance on my PC that I cannot play. Before people ask yes I do have a decent gaming rig. Not the top of the line but if I'm able to play: BF4, Borderlands PS, and AC Unity I'm sure it "should" be capable of handling the graphics on this game even if on lowest settings. However after checking obvious things like drivers/updates reinstalling and such I was unable to get this game to run on reliable framerates above 15. I opened a ticket with Team17 and one of their reps did exchange emails with me to troubleshoot the issue (briefly) but in the end i was told:

"Thank you for attempting all of the actions which we have previously recommended.
At this point, it sounds as though you might be one of the unfortunate handful who are experiencing a yet unresolved performance issue with particular system configurations. 
Please know that you information has been raised to the appropriate team and should be reviewed shortly. 
Our apologies for any inconvenience that this issue may be causing you in the meantime."

This was back in November of 2014....still nothing was done to help address this performance issue. Until this is resolved I wouldn't recommending purchasing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038886680', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2981, 'last_played': 1428865894}
review: Worms clan wars in my opinion was one the best games in the franchise, but I cannot safely reccomend this game. It IS an amazing game, and I would DEFINITELY reccomend it if you have friends to play it with, but the online community has long since died, and there is almost nobody playing anymore. If that was not the case I would be able to safely reccomend this game. Try some of their other games, as they have more active communities

author: {'steamid': '76561198045631291', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1534626768}
review:
Einfach nur 1. Klasse.
Die Steuerung ist identisch zum vorg√§nger Revolution.
Die Grafik wurde √ºberarbeitet und die Performance stark verbessert.
Es liegt sehr viel Detail in der Story und es macht sehr viel spa√ü gegen oder mit Freunden zu spielen!
Meiner Meinung nach sind es aber zu wenige Map Designs, die zudem auch noch alle recht gleich aussehen.
Wenn man sich ein wenig mit Worms auskennt, wei√ü man, was es so f√ºr Waffen gibt.
Manche wurden hier ausgelassen, daf√ºr aber neue hinzugef√ºgt. Ich w√ºrde mich aber trotzdem auf ein paar neue freuen.
Die Freude nimmt auf Dauer ein wenig ab.

Wer sich also das Spiel kaufen m√∂chte, sollte sich √ºberlegen ob er es lieber alleine spielen m√∂chte oder mit freunden :D
Es gibt ja auch ein 4er Paket was sich bei Aktionen wirklich lohnt.

Ich sags mal so.
23 Euro w√ºrde ich hier f√ºr nicht ausgeben wollen.
Man muss das Spiel zwar haben, aber 23 Euro sind mir pers√∂nlich zu viel.

Tipp: Wartet auf ein Angebot. Das Spiel gibt es dann meistens f√ºr 5 Euro zu holen. Die sind es auf jeden Fall wert! :)

Ich hab mir gleich das komplette Worms Paket f√ºr 23 Euro geholt :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198055466214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1541447873}
review: Die Worms-Reihe ist eine lustig gestaltete und am√ºsante Art von Spiel, welche sich besonders mit Freunden gut genie√üen l√§sst. Das gegenseite Verspotten und begl√ºckw√ºnschen macht nach schwierigen Sch√ºssen und gleicherma√üen verfehlten Blindg√§ngern Spa√ü und gute Laune. Der Teil "Clan Wars" bietet viele verschieden Items, Freiheit, was gestaltung der Maps und Spieleinstellungen angeht und sowohl einen Funktionierenden Multiplayer als auch einen Singleplayer. Die Graphik ist nicht grandios, ist aber devinitiv verkraftbar. Ich empfehle es allen Leuten, die Kollegen zum Spielen haben. Einzelg√§ngern w√ºrde ich eher ein anderes Spiel ans Herz legen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071931829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1682678129}
review:
Also ich pers√∂nlich bin ein Fan des Spiels geworden. Damals auf den DS noch Worms gespielt und heute am PC. Viele coole neue und viele geile alte Waffen machen das Spiel praktisch komplett :D
Gute Steuerung, gute Engine...passt ^^
Das einzige was mir fehlt sind viell. mehr Kartendesigns (wie Hochkant) und mehr Schemas (also wie Inka etc.).
(Und viell. kann mir das ja einer sagen, aber meine Statistik z√§hlt meine K√§pfe usw. nicht mit .-.
Wei√ü einer warum das so ist?)

author: {'steamid': '76561197986805120', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1387646151}
review:
I don't like it, just my personal opinion. It's the exact same game as Worms Revolution which was released 10 months earlier, but the new menu screen, weapon selection, interface and narrator are so displeasing to me that I'd rather play the old version. Worms Clan Wars feels like an unintended step backwards.

I am, however, eagerly awaiting Team17's next Worms game. Like clockwork, they've been releasing a solid title, followed by terrible one for decades now. It's no different from the 95/NT/98/2000/XP/Vista/7/8 pattern.

Ein gro√üer Minuspunkt ist die Ungenauigkeit: Man kann mit der Schrotflinte quasi durch seinen Gegner durch durch die Mauer schie√üen (ohne den Gegner zu treffen). Alleine der Punkt mindert den Spielspa√ü leider schon enorm.

Das Men√º an sich wirkt leider auch sehr un√ºbersichtlich. Wer schonmal versucht hat, ein normales LAN-Spiel zu er√∂ffnen, wei√ü vermutlich, wovon ich rede.

Alles in allem leider kein Vergleich zu den alten Titeln.

review:
Leider ein weiterer Flop.
Jeder der Worms2, Worms Armageddon oder Worms World Party gespielt hat wird stark entt√§usch werden von diesem Titel.

> Das Gameplay ist sehr langsam. 
> Die Maus hat eine eigene Mausbeschleunigung, was sehr unangenehm ist.
> Die Grafik ist zwar schick, aber sehr un√ºbersichtlich (Wenn man reinzoomt erkennt man alles gut, hat aber keine √ºbersicht, wenn man rauszoomt wird alles mikroskopisch klein)
> Es gibt die alten Spr√ºnge nicht mehr (nur noch vorw√§rts und backflip) und die Steuerung zu √§ndern ist sehr aufw√§ndig (Gibt dauernd konflikte).
> Im Wormnet ist nichts los. Es gab als ich mich gerade eingeloggt hatte gerade mal 3 offene Partien.
> Das Ninjaseil ist leider immer noch eine Zumutung.
> Bei vielen Crasht das Spiel beim ersten Start. Oft hilft Windows Media Codecs runterzuladen und zu installieren, oder einstellungen im NVidia Treiber √§ndern. Warum macht das Setup das nicht automatisch ? 

Fazit: Leider nicht f√ºr Worms Fans geeignet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035268822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1489867040}
